comments.creator: brian@briansmith.org
comments.author: brian@briansmith.org
comments.text:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #691710 +++

(In reply to Steve Workman [:sworkman] from comment #14)
> [N]onetheless, I did notice that on kickstarter.com (mentioned in comment
> #11), that the cache is bypassed (via flags) for a lot of the DNS requests. 

Why are we using nsIRequest::LOAD_BYPASS_CACHE so much for this site?

> The cache is bypassed in the code using nsIRequest::LOAD_BYPASS_CACHE, which
> is eventually mapped to nsHostResolver::RES_BYPASS_CACHE.  So, I think this
> is probably what you were observing, Michael.

Is all the code that is using nsIRequest::LOAD_BYPASS_CACHE really intending to bypass the DNS cache, or is it just trying to bypass the HTTP cache? Looking at just nsEventSource, it looks to me like the code is just trying to bypass the HTTP cache and not the DNS cache. If so, we should either change the effect that nsIRequest::LOAD_BYPASS_CACHE has on DNS lookups, or we should introduce a new LOAD_BYPASSING_HTTP_CACHE_BUT_NOT_DNS_CACHE flag and change callers to use it.
comments.raw_text:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #691710 +++

(In reply to Steve Workman [:sworkman] from comment #14)
> [N]onetheless, I did notice that on kickstarter.com (mentioned in comment
> #11), that the cache is bypassed (via flags) for a lot of the DNS requests. 

Why are we using nsIRequest::LOAD_BYPASS_CACHE so much for this site?

> The cache is bypassed in the code using nsIRequest::LOAD_BYPASS_CACHE, which
> is eventually mapped to nsHostResolver::RES_BYPASS_CACHE.  So, I think this
> is probably what you were observing, Michael.

Is all the code that is using nsIRequest::LOAD_BYPASS_CACHE really intending to bypass the DNS cache, or is it just trying to bypass the HTTP cache? Looking at just nsEventSource, it looks to me like the code is just trying to bypass the HTTP cache and not the DNS cache. If so, we should either change the effect that nsIRequest::LOAD_BYPASS_CACHE has on DNS lookups, or we should introduce a new LOAD_BYPASSING_HTTP_CACHE_BUT_NOT_DNS_CACHE flag and change callers to use it.
